Review Text: I had the rear light plugged in and charging a couple nights ago when without a sound or warning a column of flame three feet high shot up out of the device. It quickly reduced to about four inches high and with several attempts I was then able to blow out the fire.Thank God I was there in the room at the time. It happened to be about 1am at the time and it very easily could have burned down my house with me and my family in it.My guess is the lithium battery exploded, but there is no doubt it was faulty.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020

   So far so good with these lights. The blinking function on the headlight is illuminating every street sign, stop sign, and even license plates in my path, and it's making me pretty visible out there. One car even flashed their brights at me lol. The taillight I attached to the seat stay part of the back of the frame and cars are giving me a lot of room. The quick release is easy for the headlight, it takes a bit of tugging with the rear light, but both are working fine. Look at the video to gauge brightness while they are blinking (there are other settings). The price is pretty good with these, if you're on the fence, get them.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2018

Review Text: The lights seem to be great, but the mounting bracket doesn't fit on my road bike handlebars, rendering the white light useless for me.  I measured the middle section of the handlebar and it's 4" circumference. The bracket does not close and secure.So, I'll be returning and purchasing a different product. I have a Specialized Dolce women's road bike.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018

Review Text: *UPDATE*I was contacted by seller who offered a replacement light set. The new style bracket is much better. The rubber bracket is easier to attach and stretches to my new larger diameter handlebars. It seems like it will hold the light fine. I have only done a test ride and have not taken a long ride yet. Very pleased with the excellent customer service and new style bracket. THANKS!*ORIGINAL REVIEW*I had these on my old road bike for a couple of months and they worked pretty well. Bright and easy to recharge. I bought a new bike and wanted to move them but the bracket for the front light was too small for the new handlebars. The bracket is hard plastic not rubber like in the product picture. I was able to get it to stay with zip ties but during the ride the screw that holds the light to the bracket fell off and the light went flying off into the street . Goodbye light, not even going to stop and pick you up. I still have the rear light. It fits well on the stem but cannot be mounted on an under saddle bag.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2019

Review Text: They are bright and easy to put on, but both lights have similar issues.  I can't activate the buttons with my fingers, I have to use a pointy object. I've been using a house key to push the buttons because the switch is recessed too far into the body of the lights that my finger tips can't push them far enough to activate the switch.  Both rear and front.Both lights shift around while riding too, the front light strap doesn't have enough traction to keep it fixed in position so with every bump it moves either up or down.  The rear light moves a little bit too, but not as much as the front light.  I have to re-aim the headlight after every speed bump or curb I go over, and they would be useless on a night off road trail.  If I stretch the strap tighter to the next notch I think it would break.  I have ordered a bigger diameter handlebar and stem, so maybe the light will stay better fixed on the new handlebar.For $14 I am not terribly concerned about it, as I primarily bought these so the cops don't ticket me for riding at night without lights.  Home of the free and the brave, right?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2019

Review Text: This is the cheapest headlight and taillight combo on the market. It's hard to beat at this price point. The headlight is bright and rechargeable. The taillight helps the overall experience. They were very generous with the cables by giving me 2 instead on 1. Instructions were very clear as well. Came in good packaging and was all protected with foam. Not bad for $12. The beam is cool white. Battery life is impressive. After a few years, I'm am still getting 6 hours of life on high. I highly recommend this headlight to anyone who doesn't like to deal with batteries and are on a budget.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2018

Review Text: very bright light is a cheap product and great quality

Review Text: Took a chance on a cheap light, and it's worked out. Compared with a light that I know to be 200lm, this one is maybe a little brighter, 250lm at least. So the claimed 300lm is certainly plausible. The tail light is pretty nice considering how much this kit costs.My gripe is that the light has to cycle through all modes, and can't work any other way. So you can't toggle between low and high while riding, you need to cycle through flash and off. The light also shipped with the battery at 0 charge, which is a no for lithium batteries.But the light is bright as claimed, and the build quality is ok. I'd probably buy again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2019

Review Text: I REALLY wanted to like this headlight--and potentially there was I lot I COULD have liked about it--but ultimately, if you can't get the battery / charging system right on something like this, it's a waste of time and money.I bike a LOT... and I've owned many different bike headlights over the years.  So I have a bit of experience in these things.  (Or, to put it another way, I don't feel like I have unrealistic expectations--and I have a pretty extensive frame of reference when comparing and contrasting cycling head-lights and tail-lights.)  This set came with both a head-light and a tail-light--and since the tail-light so far seems to be operating fairly typically, I am mainly speaking here about the head-light.For the price, I liked a lot of things about this product.  It was reasonably bright.  The mounting system was good and easy to use.  And it had the basic light modes you want / need when riding at night.  The main problem is the battery.  I don't know if these just have a bad switch--that is allowing voltage to drain the battery when not in use--or if the batteries are just cheap junk.  But there is very little "stand-by" time with this head-light.  Meaning you have to keep it plugged in / charging right up until you need to use it--or the charge drains out too quickly--even when not in use.For example, say you are going on a road trip and you want to bring your bike--but you might not be riding it for a day or two into the road trip.  You pack up all of your cycling gear--charge up the batteries on your garmin, your head light, and your tail light--and take it all with you.  A couple of days later, when you are ready to ride--you pull everything out and mount it to the bike and head out in the afternoon for a 2 or 3 hr ride--which brings you back at night.  But, despite the fact that your head light was fully charged when you took it off the charging cable--two or three days ago--and you have not used it at all since--when you turn it on, it either dies fairly quickly--or already completely dead.  A well designed and fabricated battery operated device should have a reasonably long standby time--so that when you're ready to use it--the batteries are still holding their charge.Another example with this light:  I charge it fully, go out for a ride--say, for 1 hr--and I use the light the entire time.  I turn it off when I get back home and leave the light on my bike--for the next ride.  The manufacturer claims this light should last for FIVE HOURS on full bright without needed to be recharged.  Which means that I should have FOUR hours left on the batteries at full bright for my next ride.  However, even if I ride the next day or within a couple of days, this light is always DEAD when I try to use it a second time without re-charging.(FYI - I just tested / timed how long this light works on a full charge at full brightness--and it was only about 3 hrs... NOT even CLOSE to the 5 hrs that they claim here in Amazon.  Which certainly does not surprise me given the other batter issues I've had.)So, in my experience with these types of things, that means either the power switch is bad--and the bulb is bleeding a tiny amount of power from the battery even when in the "off" position--or the batteries or charging system are no good--or a combination of the three.I bought this light mainly because it was small and easily / USB rechargeable--and easy to mount and dis-mount to switch between various bikes (because I have many, many bikes).  I already have some bigger / brighter / heavier lights--that are more complicated to mount and dismount--if I really need to light up the night.  But since I can't trust the battery / standby life on this light, it renders it much less useful overall.I bought this to replace  a Cycle Torch light I used for quite a while--that I loved--that fell off my bike and got run over in traffic before I could safely get back to it on the road.  I almost wanted to cry when that happened--because that was almost the perfect bike headlight.  However it is nearly 2x more expensive than this Ascher--though also 200 lumens brighter (I think).  (I can't find a specific lumens claim for this headlight in the Amazon listing details... but when I searched the "Q/A section just above the Reviews, someone answered that the headlight was 300 lumens; the Cycle Torch Shark is stated at 500 lumens on Amazon.)  Though the battery life on the cycle torch was definitely getting weaker over time (I had it / used it for many years)... I never had this problem of it going completely dead in a day or two if not used--after fully charged.  Even the brand new Cycle Torch on eBay only claims a TWO hour run time on "high"... which is honestly pretty similar to what I was getting / expecting from my +/- 5 yr old version.  And, compared to the only +/- 3 HR run time for this Ascher head-light... which is supposedly 200 lumens less... 3 hrs sounds about right.  (I never believed the 5 HR claim.)So, right now I'm trying to figure out exactly how to contact the seller to file a warranty claim for this head-light.  They don't SPECIFICALLY mention a warranty period or process ANYWHERE on this Amazon page for the product.  But I'll try contact them directly to see what they say... if that is even possible.  (Update: Turns out it is not possible at all.  Essentially, the ONLY warranty / returns availalbe on this light are during the initial 30 day period after you purchase it--that virutally ALL items purchased on Amazon have.  So, be aware when you buy this headlight that if it fails after just 30 days... you're out of luck.  Thanks, Amazon.)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: This light worked great for the first charge. Super bright and did what it was meant to do. But after it died and I charged it, it's brightness is literally 1/20th of what it was. Review Text: Update - no it lasted about 15 minutes..... buying a Blitzu which is 10  and has lasted years.After using it, I rate it 1 Star because it will not last a long ride.  I am only riding one hour per day currently and it lasts 2.5 rides......when I start long rides again, it will not last the ride.I really like the fact you dont need screw drivers and spacers like most lights.  Since it attaches with a rubber strap it forms to any shape.  It is also bright and it took one spill and still works.  I have other more high priced lights and these seem to work as well.  I cannot attest to battery life yet.

Review Text: I am amazed with this light set. The headlight is ridiculously bright. I usually keep it down on the dimmer setting to save battery and for being seen and not to blind oncoming traffic, but if you need extra light to see further and ride faster it's got it. ​I actually use it as a flashlight more than I do for riding. Just pop it off the mount and use it for whatever. I live by the water and it's even bright enough to use as a spotlight for boating. In the pic, that tree in the center is 60 feet away and you can see how bright it is in pitch dark with no other lights nearby.The mounting system is super easy and functional and you can put them almost anywhere you want on the bike. The taillight can be mounted in 90 degree increments in any direction so you can mount it on a vertical or horizontal bar. I've had them in the rain and there is no problem with water resistance. The charge ports have rubber seals that you close when not charging. The batteries last longer than I've tested. I charge them after a few rides so I actually don't know how much longer they last. More than enough for my needs.I will be buying more. I would like it better with just hi-lo-off or separate on-off and mode switches so you don't have to click through the four modes to turn off. No need for the flashing modes. That would make it more convenient for flashlight use as well. Great job, Ascher.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021

Review Text: I just now attached these to my recumbent trike.  The elastic band on the headlight stretches enough to go around the pedal assembly.  I have a basket on the back so the tail light attaches to a length of pvc pipe.  The same size elastic band works here, too.  The lights are easy to turn on and off, much easier than my last pair.  Also much easier to remove for battery recharging.  So far, so good.

Review Text: This light is amazing. No one could ever say that couldn’t see you at night, or during the day for that matter. The bright setting has cars flashing their brights at me. So there is a dimmer setting too. I use the bright setting as I can see as far as I can ahead of me. I ride to work most days. Early morning I need the lights and work late sometimes too. I ride past an area where several deer pop out of no where and run across the road. I use the double flash setting to hopefully keep them from popping out. So far it’s worked. Best light I have ever purchased. Easy to put on and take off and does not bounce, period. I take it off when I leave the bike outside. It’s too valuable to me to let someone walk away with.

Review Text: The front light seems to still be going strong with about 2x a month usage. The rear light has stopped working and stopped taking a charge a few months ago. it turns on when it's plugged into the charging cable but it does not turn on when removed. While charging the little led inside the light (in the circuit board) should light up red and then turn to green when finished - this is how it's always worked up until recently. now it goes straight to green when I plug it in, but this is obviously incorrect as there is no light when unplugged.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021

Review Text: I never rode at night so I never had to worry about a light. I live in a 55+ development and people her don't see as well as they may have. I saw some other riders with lights and during the morning hours I could see them a good way off. Since I have started riding with the Ascher lights all I get are compliments. From walkers and other bike riders. They keep asking and I keep yelling Amazon. I'll have to add Ascher to my yelling on the way by. I have started to ride at night and instead of the high speed flash I use the continuous white. The flashing light during the day has stopped a few people from backing out of their driveways. I just ordered a second set so that when I am riding at night I have a spare. Good investment. Oh, I am 77 and ride almost everyday, 2 hours minimum and 20 miles. Good Times
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020

Review Text: Got it 5 months ago. Rarely ride in the dark so I didn't use it except when I initially got it to make sure it worked. When I used it initially for real the first time, it didn't work. I figured the charge had depleted even though I never used it so I 'recharged' it overnight. Tried to use it again a month later and the exact same thing. Even when it's plugged in, if I turn the light on, an LED light flashes and it turns off. Something is broken and I'm beyond my return window so I'm screwed basically
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021

Review Text: I like that these are rechargeable and have multiple patterns (full/half brightness, slow/fast flashing). I feel much safer riding at any time of day or night with these. I usually use the rear red light in one of the flashing modes at all times. During daylight, dusk, or dawn the white light is in flashing mode. At night, it clearly lights the road even on half brightness. I will likely give these as gifts once I've tested them out long-term. Great product at a great price and a must-have accessory!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021

Review Text: I'm impressed overall with the product, it works as expected and the quality is good.  I'm a little concerned about the durability of the mounting release tabs, but time will tell.  They lost one star for packaging.  I understand making sure that your product is protected on it's way to the consumer, but I would like it to be done in a way that is environmentally responsible.  This item came packaged in a paperboard box, wrapped in plastic, with a plastic insert, making recycling more challenging.  The plastic wrap is unnecessary and a paper product could have been used for the insert.  Ultimately I would like to see Ascher use 100% post consumer paper for all of their packaging, and I would like the packaging details noted in the product description.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020

Review Text: These are a great value for a set of USB rechargeable Front and Rear safety lights. They are bright enough to be seen around sunrise and sunset. The headlight could definitely light your path on dimly lit city streets, but I would not rely on it to be your only source of light for nighttime trail riding in complete darkness. I recommend these to anyone commuting before or after daylight hours. They are easy to install/remove with a strap that wraps around your bike handlebars or seat post. And you can remove the lights from the strap mount with a quick detach clip. Both the front and rear lights have 4 modes: bright-constant on, slightly dimmed-constant on, bright-slow flashing, bright-quick flashing. Power button must be pressed to cycle between all modes to turn off. If you’ve read all of this, then you should just buy them already.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020

Review Text: The light is pretty bright, has decent battery life., and good purchase for the price. The rear lights were a nice addition and gave me zero issues. Unfortunately, it has a couple of big problems that caused me to take two stars off.I purchased 2 of these back in September 2019 for biking around NYC. One is still running strong to this day, but the other one stops holding charge in the battery after about 6 months or so (the light still works otherwise).Another super annoyance is one of the mounting systems is a bit loose. Sometimes when I encounter a big bump/pothole (quite common in NYC) the light would pop off the mount.If Ascher manages to fix these problems in future iterations, it's a pretty solid buy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021

Review Text: The light itself is good, casts a nice beam and is a good color and pretty bright.  Disappointed in the mounts for both lights.  Cheap plastic brackets and the silicone straps are both tearing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020

Review Text: I have been using a pair of smaller rechargeable lights which are excellent. My rides are going a little longer and it is getting darker so I figured I would try these lights. These lights are very bright! They are easy to install, easy to charge, and really light up the road. They are a must have for bicycle riders in my opinion-Along with a reflective vest and perhaps a rechargeable wearable light vest. I just received them so I can't comment on the Longer-term use of the product, but I have used them for five days-for  about five hours and needed to charge them once. They are very easy to charge and put on the bicycle. I particularly like that the rear light has an adjustable bracket so that you could angle the light down a little bit for better visibility.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019

Review Text: I don't always ride my bike in the dark but when I do I'm happy to have this light. I keep it on all the time. Lights make you more visible. I appreciate when other riders have their lights on so I do the same. Even pedestrians have commented they can see me better. I mostly ride smoother trails so have not tested on too rough of surfaces, but for local rail trail rides, this is great!Currently only have one which I share between my two bikes and it takes only a moment to take off and reinstall. Battery life is real good. I make it a habit to recharge before a big trip and the only time it has died on me was after leaving it in my garage all (northeast) winter. So that didn't surprise me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021

The taillight still works, but having the headlight fail within a few months is unacceptable.

Review Text: Bought this set for my wife’s bike and it works very well. Mounting is easy on & easy off. Charging was fast with the USB cable that was included. We can charge in the car or at home, however we have to use our own wall receptacle adapter when charging at home because that is not included. I already have an old set for my bike but like this better and am considering upgrading to it. Headlight is noce and bright and taillight brings attention to it from a considerable distance.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021

Review Text: DO NOT USE ON KIDS BIKEThe first time my boys fell in their bikes the  front lights broke off and no longer stay locked in place so every time they lay the bike down the light falls off.I bought two, and one of the lights stays charged great but the other doesnt hold charge at all so I have to charge every night after we go on our 2 to 3 mile ride.Both the back and front lights on that set die quickly. But the other set I bought stay charged fine.Both lights are very bright and I like them alot, im just disappointed that they broke so easily on my kids bike.I only reccomend for adults and have a 50% success rate with the charging situation.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020

Review Text: I take midnight rides around my neighborhood, well I used to walk but then my wife got me an Eliptigo R-SUB (very cool, serious workout) bike for my birthday so I now ride around the neighborhood and rarely do I encounter anyone else on the way. But now I have the Ascher Ultra Light Bright Rechargeable Light I am not in any danger of hitting anyone I might run into on those rare occasions, more importantly I can see to avoid any potholes or sticks or cats (once I hit a black cat on a black road in the black of night). However, due to the design of my bike (there is no seat) there isn't a good place to mount the rear red light but that isn't a fault or shortcoming or defect of the light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021

Review Text: Charges hold for my entire ride, which is a couple hours. Unsure of their limit. Were easy to apply to the bike. Used a couple times and they are bright. Upgraded from 4 stars because I thought the headlight didn’t  click in the mount, but the mount was on backwards. Learned this the hard way as it fell off while I was adjusting it on my first ride. They got rained on and were fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018

Review Text: I recently bought this to put on the handle bars of my bike as a bike light. But when I turned it on, I wasn't expecting to see the surface of the sun glistening into my small beady little eye balls. Lit up my entire room, and the reflection off the white walls has burned my cornias. After my vision came back, I tested at night time. I now know I can literally see about 6 miles ahead of me. I turned on the strobe mode and started having a seizure. If you want something that can see clear to your mom's house, pick this up. But if you like your eye balls, get something with less power.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020

Review Text: So far,  I am impressed. Arrived quickly and the packaging was very nice. I really like the ease of the mounting system of both lights. Rear light charged in about an hour, but the front headlight took over four hours to charge. The rear light has the capability of mounting vertical or horizontal, that’s a nice feature. I just got these lights and haven’t used them enough for a proper review. I will update after having used them a bit longer. So far these are much better than I expected.

Review Text: It’s not bad, it does the job, but it could be brighter.I am a very casual bike ride are usually just ride with my family.I got this light to test it out and see if I would order more for the rest of my family.Becomes well packaged and with everything you need to get going.Battery seems to last but it gets very dim within about 20 to 30 minutes.I believe I read that the highest output was 300 lm and I don’t think it’s 300 lm, I could be wrong but whatever it starts out at within 20 to 30 minutes it probably Dems down about 50%.The construction is a hard plastic and it seems sturdy enough. The installation is extremely easy and so is recharging.The best part about this light is the tail light that came with it. It’s extremely bright flashing red light can be seen very easily down the street and it to is rechargeable.I ordered a different headlight that also came with a tail light but that tail light is not rechargeable, however the other light does stay brighter longer.I’m still within the return window so I might return this one to get the other one.But all in all it’s not a bad product.

Review Text: Great light set, and you can’t beat the price. Both the headlight and taillight have four lighting functions. Both lights are rechargeable, and the battery lasts a long time. The set is very light and compact. I usually remove the lights and easily carry them in my pocket while I am away from my bike. I am a daily bicycle commuter, but I love this so much I am going to order a second set for my wife’s bike to us on our occasional evening bike rides.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019

Review Text: These are the second pair of lights I've tried, and they work GREAT.  The rear light has incredible battery life.  I've used it on multiple century rides (around 6-7 hrs) and it holds power the entire time, amazingly enough.  (When set to the flashing mode.)The front light holds battery well enough, but not nearly as long because it definitely puts out a higher luminescence.  I've used it on night rides and foggy mornings and it works great.  I can see well enough in front of me to avoid obstacles in the road.What's really cool about these lights is the size (very small and light), the battery life, and the ability to angle the mounts up and down.  This is especially helpful for the front light because you can either aim it straight (so cars can see you) or toward the ground (when night riding/to avoid obstacles), and you don't need multiple mounts to do this.  Highly recommend. :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: First, the package was missing the strap to hold on the front light - I messaged them and they said to return the whole thing and order  new one, but I had already thrown out the packaging not realizing that the front strap was missing. I figured I would just use zip ties to hold it on, even though it is RIDIUCLOUS that they  don't even sell replacement straps. But the front light ONLY works while charging. Once you unplug it from the charger, it stops working. I threw the whole thing out and I'm ordering something else.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021

Review Text: I've purchased several bike lights from Amazon, and these are by far the best. They're attractive, they're bright (illuminating the rider AND the road), and they're at a very affordable price. The installation is easy, but I DID install the front light backwards the first time I used it (resulting in it falling off of the bike). It slides BACKWARDS into handlebar attachment. I've also used it as a flashlight when hiking and it works great.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

It delivers.Hopefully I'll use it on my bike in the future, lol.

Review Text: We ordered 2 sets of these lights for biking at night, and they are perfect! The headlight is super bright and can illuminate a dark path so that you can see exactly where you're going. The tail light is also bright, we set it to slow strobe and cars in the neighborhood have no problem seeing us.  And because the lights are so bright, we can always see each other, even at a long distance. You can also turn the brightness to half in case its too bright for you.  Excellent lights.Also, customer service was extremely helpful, fast, and courteous in helping me resolve an issue with the attaching band, 100% satisfied!If you are still trying to decide which light set to buy for your bike, you really don't need to think anymore. Get this one, you'll be very pleased!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020

Review Text: I have bought numerous sets of these lights, but I have stopped because of issues each time. So in conclusion, I have found these lights to not be a good investment because of their recurring issues.

Review Text: I've had this headlight and taillight several months now and so far, very, very good for the money. Bike shop lights of similar brightness and functionality cost two or three times more. This is a heckuva deal for the money. Holds a charge and recharges well (although it does take several hours when it's low). EVERYONE who shares the road with today's multitude of distracted drivers need to ride with lights (flashing during the day, constant at night). Get a light! It could save your life!

Review Text: Ordered 2 sets of these lights ( 4 lights total , 2 front and 2 rear).Had a minor issue with one of the rear lights not turning green when the light was fully charged.  Mentioned this in my original review.  Their Customer saw my remarks and reached out to me.  Bottom line they sent me another complete set which I received  as fast as possible.  We used our lights for a three hour ride and were happy with the results.  They maintained their charge and provided excellent visibility of our positions on the trail! I would recommend these lights for their performance and even more importantly for their fantastic customer service!!

Review Text: Bought this in Sept 2019. I used it extensively commuting  to and from work for a few months, then winter set in. Then with the pandemic, traffic was lighter and I didn't use the light as much while riding in full daylight. Sometime in Fall/Winter of 2020/2021 the front light stopped working. Every time I charge it up, within hours it will be dead again whether I turn it ion or not.The rear light still holds a charge, and runs for hours.I didn't think of this light set as "disposable" but maybe the manufacturers do?

Review Text: I use this set on my power chair when I go to events at our local park.I can cruise home on the unlit bike path with light to spare from the headlight, and not have to worry about a bicyclist rearending me (yup. Review Text: He usado varias luces para mi silla de ruedas y está encajó a la perfección… Las luces traseras las puedes instalar vertical u horizontal, ademas tiene ajuste para inclinarlo a la posición que más te convenga lo cual me cayo anillo al dedo ya que la tengo instalada en un tubo curvo en la parte trasera de mi silla de ruedas y puedo ajustar el ángulo para que se vea bien por detrás… Las bases las instalas en los tubos tanto la de adelante como la de atrás y las luces las puedes quitar e instalar fácilmente al dejar las bases pegadas del tubo, ideal para cargarlas
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021

Review Text: The battery lasts me 4-5 sessions.  I ride for about 25 minutes a night and I'm able to get through 4-5 nights without re charging.  The headlamp is fairly bright, I don't know the lumens, but it's bright enough to see a good 15-20' in front of you and it's a white light.  It has a bright, less bright, blinking and SOS mode.  The tail light has a solid, fast blink and slow blink mode.  Overall, I'm very satisfied.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020

Review Text: The lights are bright, bright enough for deep forest mtb trails at night. The rear light is perfect, light and bright. However, while the front light is great, the mounting strap is terrible. It's led to my front light falling off on a light trail, and on one occasion even road riding. When I strap it tighter, the silicone started ripping, and eventually it fell off on a ride. While I found the light, the mounting system seems custom made and the strap is all torn up, so I can't rig up a ziptie mount. Seems like the manufacturer should've included more straps, used a different system, made the front light less heavy, or made a more robust strap system.3 stars, only because of the light quality and rear light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

Review Text: My son was excited when our Ascher USB rechargeable lights arrived. They were easy to install and did not need charging before use. We have used them for a month on that same charge without charging and the battery life is phenomenal. Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020

Review Text: I was about to write a really positive review for these lights when the white one died. It won't hold a charge anymore after just 4.5 months of daily use, so it doesn't turn on anymore.Before then, I was happy with them--bright, easy to recharge, easy to put on and take off the brackets. The only thing I didn't like about them before the white one died is the mount for the white light - it doesn't grip the front bar hard enough to keep the white light in place. Because it's heavier, the white light would always slip so it was pointing down whenever I hit a bump or something. It's easy enough to fix by just readjusting it with my hand, but not always very convenient in the middle of a ride, especially if there is traffic around or the road is uneven.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Review Text: This is a great setup for if you ride at night and want to be seen. You'll definitely be seen. It's nice that they're rechargeable. It's bright enough that you'll be seen, but if you do a lot of night riding, I'd suggest something that will light your path better. Review Text: My wife and I ride on country roads where it is most important to be seen, at night, at dusk, in fog and in cloudy weather.  These lights perform extremely well for those, functions, bright and flashy.  What surprised me is that the headlight actually provides enough light to see ahead and ride at night.  We are very happy with these lights and like that they are rechargeable.  I haven't owned them long enough to know how long the charge lasts, but they have been fine so far.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020

Review Text: These things have been in rain, my kids have left them outside in a New England February (mud then frozen) and they still work like a champ.  They've been dropped as well and continue to impress.  The lights are extremely bright and are used daily for bike rides and walking the dog.  The strobe features work well.  The  tail lights are very bright and work flawlessly too.  Charges last a long time and after a while of not plugging one in I'll find that it still has plenty of life left in it where others will just drain.  I wish it had a battery life indicator, but for the price, these are solid.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020

Review Text: This is a nice light set with a strong beam. I found the beam a little narrow for mounting on the bike compared to another one I had so I mounted these lights on my helmet and they work great there. I had a replacement battery light before so the rechargeable feature is a nice bonus and the battery lasts a long time.

Review Text: The first time I rode with the light set, the headlight fell off. I didn't realize it at the time. In fact, I though someone threw something at me that skittered under my bike. Regardless, I am giving it another chance and bought a replacement set.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020

Review Text: Initially, I thought this was a great light. very bright, several settings, included rear light. I purchased on Mat 16, yesterday August 24 (3 months later) the battery on the tail light went out after only one hour. Today I was riding and I noticed on both the head light and the tail light the battery was dead after only 45 minutes. Both were charged overnight.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2021

Review Text: We purchased 3 of these lighting systems in the past for for 2 bicycles I have and one my wife has.  I have used one of my bikes to ride daily to early coffee with my friends before the sun comes up so a  good lighting system is really nice to have.  Recently I rode one of my bikes with the system on it on an unpaved trail during the day with some moderate bumps.  Somewhere on that trip my front headlight slipped off of its slide on mounting.  I didn’t see it happen, just one moment on the ride it was there and then after a while I noticed it was gone.  I do really like these lighting systems so I purchased another one recently (the one related to your message below) to replace the light that slipped off.  In the future I will leave the front light off of its mounting until I need it.  You make a fine product at a reasonable price.  I would recommend your lighting system to anyone.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020

Review Text: Here is the thing about this light.  It's super bright and I was pumped when I used it.HOWEVER, when I was riding today the front light unclipped from my bike (in spite of not being jostled) and somehow managed to bounce under a car and completely disappear.I know what you are thinking, "obviously it rolled into a gutter", but that's where you are wrong.  Not only where there no gutters but the only possible explanation as to where this ended up that I could come up with is that it somehow took a hard bounce up into the chassis of the ford taurus i spent 20 minutes looking under.As far as a light goes it's bright AF, but I only was able to use it once before it fell off my bike and seemingly bounced into a wormhole so -2 stars for that but the rear light is still holding strong.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020

Review Text: These are my first set of lights for my bike, and they work great!  This was easy to install (even with the milk crate on the back on my bike, which I use for transporting bigger items), and bright enough so that I can see at least 15 ft in front of me--enough so that I was able to spot a dollar-coin sized baby snapping turtle on the path by the river & avoid it!  (yes, I did stop and bring the turtle back to the river).  Very pleased with the purchase, especially for the price.  I also appreciate that they are chargeable, which saves money on batteries.  Definitely recommend
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
        


   This light system is just what I was looking for (A bike store nearby sold this same set for over $100). I bike a lot at night because I live near my job and work the later shift (usually getting off between 7-9pm). Mounting was easy breezy, all light modes work on both of my lights. The headlight is brighter than the brightest flashlight setting on my iPhone (shown in video). I love the fact that each light came with their own separate charging wire instead of one for both. Definitely a recommend in my book.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021

Review Text: The different flashing options on the light were really nice, the lighting was adequate to navigate a road with some street lights and dark patches at dusk. The light was easy to install but the rubber mount to angle the light on the handlebar kept slipping and the light would not stay steady. It would droop very easily so it practically became useless to keep adjusting that thing. After few weeks of using it, taking the light off of the mount lock became really difficult. The little rail things that lock the light onto the mount kept degrading and while riding on a rough road, the light kept slipping and angling down on the rubber mount. The hard lock eventually just broke and the light fell off the mount onto the road in traffic. Here I am now looking for a new light because within a few weeks of using this light I am again having to buy a new one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020

Review Text: I used to have a very similar light for my bike, but I didn't fully read the instructions. If you don't constant charge, it wouldn't recharge after sometime. I regret to buy that one. This one, in the other hand, is great. it's very reliable, the button is a real one (not just a touch thing that sometimes does not work). I need a reliable one since I use it during hurricane season as a backup. looks it will last a lot of time.I haven't enough time to check the battery life, but it is still working out of the box.I'll update this review if something comes up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020

Review Text: This bike light is the best one I used so far! I bike commute about 20 miles a day and often at night. This light is incredibly bright. It recharges in a couple of hours and the battery lasts for a long time. This is the second one I’ve bought. The first one lasted for almost two years of daily use before the battery stopped holding a charge. This is an excellent headlight for anyone who regularly bikes at night!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020

Review Text: I have re-charged these only one time, and a little blinking red light told me that the battery was running low. Review Text: The first time I used this light, I thought it was odd that the front light didn't "click" into place into the clip on my handlebars. I thought it might just be stubborn, so I applied some overpressure and it still didn't "click" into the clip.  No big deal, or so I thought...About 6 miles into my second ride with the light, I looked down and noticed the holder was empty.  Not what you want to see. I hadn't noticed it fall out (there was a lot of traffic), but knew it had been there when I started.  After retracing my ride, I found the light, but it had already been run over car and smashed.  I was really disappointed and wished I the clip held it in place securely, especially since the light seemed to be bright and lightweight up until that unfortunate moment! Money down the drain!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020

Review Text: I received this Ascher product (both front and rear lights with 2 usb cables) and it was very bright and very difficult for cars to not notice the lights. This was for one of my kids so I'm very happy with it. However, the rear light came defective. I had planned to return it but then contacted the seller through Amazon. They were fast fast fast resolving the issue. They're sending my not 1 but 2 rear lights. So far so good. I should receive in a few days so will update on those when it arrives. However, I really really like this product, which is why I reached out to the seller. I really like that the front light can become a flashlight. They're all rechargeable with 2 usb cables, included. I am amazed at how bright the lights are and the various modes makes it a great safety item. It has a bright mode, a slightly dimmer mode, and 2 blinking modes. It's very very easy to put onto the bike rear and the front handles.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020

Review Text: Light stopped working last week.When it was working, I loved it.  Lots of light, was super bright with diff modes to conserve/use energy.  Was easy to remove and attach to different bike/scooter.  Versatile/easy-to-use shape as a flashlight or etc.Still, the mount would slip when riding, so mid-ride, I'd have to adjust it periodically.  Rubber cap covering USB charging port had broken off long ago.But now, it decides to stop working if I go over a bump.  It won't work again until I plug in the charging cable again.  But, if I go over a bump again, it stops working again.No problems with taillight - still works and no broken pieces.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020

Review Text: This light was surprisingly bright to me. The back light just being an added bonus. Super easy to install and remove. Charges fast. The pictures were from a completely dark garage. Has some unnecessary blinking options, but hey, just don’t have to use them. I would buy this again if needed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2019

Review Text: Not sure if I got a defective light, but it does not last the advertised 6.5 hours. If you bike a lot, I'd recommend investing a little more into lights that you won't have to charge every 3 days (the charging also takes forever)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2018

Review Text: I ordered these lights after ordering the Vont Pyro lights and being disappointed with them.The Ascher USB rechargeable (headlight and taillight are both rechargeable) lights are great. The headlight (300 lumen) is incredibly bright for a $20 light and they last forever (full charged full brightness 5 hours). And the taillight is bright as well and definitely makes you seen by other cyclist or cars.The rubber straps that you use to attach both lights feels strong and sturdy and attach really easily. I also like how you can adjust the headlight side to side and up and down and the taillight can be used in either vertical or horizontal positions.And I love that you can detach both lights so people can't steal them off your bike if you so choose and I like being able to use the headlight as a stand alone flashlight which I have on many occasions.I included a side buy side of the Ascher headlight and the Vont Pyro headlight and you can clearly see the difference. Ascher on the right, Vont on the left.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020

Review Text: Bright light, but I found much brighter for almost the same price. If you ride after dark on the streets, you will want and need it to light the way so go for a much bigger lum.  This is bright to be seen, or to use as a flashlight but I noticed the real difference when riding and comparing it to another that very clearly lit the path to where you could see more of the path ahead and surrounding.  This one turned out to not be enough, because by the time I end my ride it is dark.  This is good if you want to be seen on a bike path.  I ride sometimes on the streets and neighborhoods, I want to make sure cars see me and Im not an afterthought they didnt see till it was too late. I found out I needed more a 4000 or greater lum before I really felt comfortable with traffic. Plus I purchased colorful wheel lights in addition and the wherl lights made a nice display and I get constant compliments on how neat they look.  So if you use ghis with additional lights it would cdfinitely be a plus.  But great for trail riders or sidewalks.  Just go bigger if your going to be on the street at any point.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020

Review Text: Clip will not hold the light on the mount.  Not engineered well.  Plastic tab does not have enough tension to hold it. LOVE the shape, brightness, rubber mount.  But it needs to stay on the bike.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020

Review Text: After lots of research, I selected this bike light set and am very happy with the purchase. Both the front and tail lights are high quality.  The lights are very bright, have multiple light settings, and come in professional looking packaging. In addition, the lights have remained securely fastened on my handlebars and seat bag, even when riding on bumpy trails, although the tail light strap could have been a bit tighter. I really like that the lights are rechargeable and the battery life seems good.My only complaint is that the front light needs a visible indicator to know which light setting it is set on. Without an indicator, I have to put my hand in front of the light to check the setting when riding.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020

Review Text: Packaging is very nice. Quality is very nice. I am a snob for led lighting and I'm very satisfied with both lights. Well made. (Its made of plastic but still seems like it will last). I turned on the headlight right out of the box and any doubts I had of not liking this product were dissolved. Extremely bright. Quite impressive . I wish the flash pattern was more of a strobe than flash but still I'm happy. The rear light has a good strobe pattern. The straps seem adequate. The front light's strap is the product's downfall. It is made of very elastic rubber that doesnt hold the light on as secure as I would like. If you press the on button while mounted, the light slides and points down.  The charging ports are in great locations, and the dust covers are nice and sturdy feeling. I have yet to test the battery life but from what I have experienced so far, I give this product 9/10 . I plan on buying another. Huge bang for your buck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020

Review Text: This is a good product at this price point.  The front and back light has multiple settings to control the brightness and flashing sequence.  My only issue with it is the front light bracket that I received was hard plastic and not the rubber kind as pictured.  When I was riding two weeks ago, I think one of the front light bracket's nut was loose so the front light flew off.  I was able to retrieve the front light but the bracket is off and I can't attach the front light to the bracket anymore.  Now I have to use a zip tie to tie the front light to my helmet in order to use it.  It looks ghetto but it still works.  Overall, I'm happy with the product's durability, brightness and cost; but disappointed at the front bracket coming loose so easily.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019

Review Text: these combo bike lights on amazon are all garbage with fake reviews. save your money and buy a real bike brand light, these cheap products from china and stuff never last long. I have bought 4 different bike light combo sets like this off amazon over the last couple years and they have all broke. This one does not fit properly in its bracket to click in place so i had to secure it with a rubber band. then last night the light went out all together and does not turn on or charge.

Review Text: I have two sets of these lights. Lights are bright. I generally like them but the battery on the headlight now doesn't hold a charge that lasts more than 20 minutes. Review Text: Does everything I wanted without a lot of bells and whistles. The headlight has 4 settings that come on in order: bright / dim / slow flash / double flash / off. Review Text: This bike light set is amazing!  I was so excited to see how it worked that I charged it as soon as I received it, and later that night went for a bike ride.  It is very bright and you can see very far in front of you.  It lit up the whole bike trail.  The rear headlight is also very bright.  The features that this light has are perfect.  I love that you can make them blink while you are riding.

Review Text: Picked up this set because I often have to bike at night to commute around NYC. The thing that was attractive about the product was that it came with a USB rechargeable battery. The rear light maintains its charge longer, but the button to turn it on is of poor quality(it fell off after 2rides). Regardless, its a cheap set and gets the job done for the most part, the only exception is that before you go for a ride of any length make sure to charge it overnight.

Review Text: Could use longer battery life for the headlamp, but I have a regular battery powered one that I use for the first part of the ride as a day time running light then turn that one off and this one in when it starts getting dark.

Review Text: Bought this light as a replacement for a battery operated light that went bad. The Ascher light is significantly brighter, easily recharged and was very easy to install. Review Text: Install in seconds. Will fit many size bars with adjustable rubber strap. Quick release for use as a flashlight and recharging with the provided USB cords. Review Text: This thing is bad ass! Holds a charge for months, super bright, and is easy to attach as a headlight for a bike, wagon, stroller, walker/walking stick, or even as a camping light.    I used the lights for approximately 4 months with semi-regular riding. I would charge the battery up fairly often after 4-5 hours of use.One morning after turning the light on, it would NOT change modes or turn off. I attempted to plug it in and fully charge it, it did not matter. I let the battery completely drain and charge it up again. Did not matter. It will not shut off at all or change modes. Disappointing as this seemed to be a good light up until this point.No issue with the small red light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2020

Review Text: I have had these lights for 9 months now. Really liked these lights when I first got them.  The light mounted easily to handlebars and could be removed just as easily.  Unfortunately, their longevity is not up to snuff.  The clip that holds the white light to the handlebar mount no longer holds it in place.  Riding over rough roads, the light vibrates out of the mount.  Also, when I first got the light, the battery life was very acceptable.  Could easily get 8-10 hours use before charge.  Now, I'm lucky to get 3.  Which I could recommend these lights because they are very bright and easy to mount/use, but their lifespan is too short.  They need to last longer than 9 months.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021

Review Text: I bought this set for my 15-year-old grandson who rides 10 miles or more each day for fun and relaxation.  As darkness came earlier with each day, he needed the light more and more.  This set totally met our expectations and allowed him to ride safely as days grew shorter.  It identifies him to motorists and provides light for him to see what is in front of him.  It is a very high quality system and I would recommend it without reservation.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Review Text: Front light is very bright! Like a proper torch. Backlight is a bonus, nice but not too bright. I have the ApaceVision for that so I'll give the backlight away.The mount seemingly is too small at first. As you can see in the photos, I fit 2 fingers through. But I managed to attach it to my handle bar AND I have a wide aero handlebar on my other bike. You just have to stretch the hell out of it, but it works!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021

Review Text: I have had this light for about a year on my road bike and regularly use the headlight (not the tail light).  I only use the strobe to get the longest duration.  The strobe light will operate for many hours and gives you a warning before it's close to dying.  I can't speak for night usage as don't use it for that.  However, on 1 ride, the light slid off the mounting bracket.  After that, I couldn't get it to stay on the mounting bracket at all as just slides off it - not sure if it's the mounting bracket or the mount under the light that slides into it (or both).  Regardless, while the light is fantastic, don't expect the mount/bracket to last very long.  I have sent multiple emails to the company with no response (18 mo. warranty).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021

Review Text: It's a good bike light apart from one thing: it keeps falling off.  It slides onto a holder that wraps around the handle bar, but nothing about the holder clasps / keeps it in place.  I angle my bike light down slightly (so it's not in other bikers' eyes) and so after a few rides of hitting bumps, the light pops off.

Review Text: First time out, the sliding mechanism to attach the light to the bike failed after a block and I lost my light under a car. Review Text: I purchased the Asher Ultra Bright USB Rechargeable Bike Light Set through Amazon Prime on September 7, 2020.  It comes with an 18 month warranty and for the first couple of months worked fine, no problems.  But in February (6 months after purchase) the light would not recharge.  As per instructions in the  User Manual I sent an email to : kate.brigen@gmail.con and explained the problem.  I received no response to my email and then I followed up with a second email and again received no response.  I then contacted Amazon directly and they sent a prepaid shipping label and I returned the light.  I did not receive a full refund initially, but when I called Amazon they issued an additional credit and I was refunded in full.  Amazon made it right, however I will never purchase another Ascher LED Bike Light Set.  I am very disappointed and upset with Ascher for not responding to either of my emails as instructed to do so via the user manual.  Save yourself a headache and time on the phone, DO NOT purchase this product!

   Pros:Very bright light. We were going on a bike trail and chanced upon some guys with T-shirts from the local expensive bike shop. Review Text: The lights are bright with good battery life.  I like the bracket which allows easy removal for recharging.  The rear light is rechargeable and improves visibility greatly.  It is very light weight and charges very quickly.  One suggestion for the manufacturer is to have 2 different brackets available for mounting these.  The one supplied is great for anything large enough for the rubber band to stretch around, but it would be nice to have another that has a rigid clip instead of the rubber band.  That would allow it to be clipped onto pockets or the loop on my seat pack which would prevent it from bouncing around.  The headlight is balanced a little too far forward so if the band is not tight around whatever it is mounting too, it will tend to tilt forward.  Overall a usable and valuable product at a great value.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019

Review Text: These lights meet all the qualities of a good bike light...easy-to-install, easy to charge, and certainly seems bright enough. I like that there are different brightness and strobe settings, I like USB charging instead of AAA batteries, and I like how easy it was to install (no tools needed). The only thing I wish it would have would be some indicator of how much battery life is left. I've had these lights installed on my bike for a few months now and rode once in the rain. The lights are still as good as new.UPDATE: I've been using these lights for a number of months and was still satisfied with my purchase. However, I moved the lights to my Mtn bike and during the ride, somehow the front light fell off and I didnt notice it until later. I did find that the front light attachment did not seem too secure as the clip from the light to the mount seemed to not positively engage. I guess the light either worked its way out of the mount due to vibration or I bumped it. Either way, I was sad that the light disappeared. Since I was still satisfied with the "value" of the light, I ended up buying another set. This time, I did notice that the front light has a positive 'click' when sliding it into the mount. I guess my first light had a minor manufacturing issue? The other thing I noticed on my first light (before I lost it), was that there is a rubber o-ring around the housing. That o-ring somehow got all stretched out so that it no longer seated tightly into its groove. I took the o-ring off but noticed that it seemed that this rubber gasket is just for aesthetics. the groove it fits into is not a joint as the outer body of the light seemed to be sealed.  I am no 100% sure if that o-ring served a functional purpose, but either way, it no longer fit inside its groove and I removed it. I did not ride in the rain after removing it, so no idea if its removal would create a water-intrusion issue into the light. In any event, this is something I'll keep an eye on for my second light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020

Review Text: Light does not work unless it’s plugged into the wall.  It shows green as it’s fully charged, but when I unplug it don’t turn on.  If I turn it on whilst it’s still plugged into the wall it worksSeller replaced-  new one works wonderfully!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020

Review Text: For his & hers bike I got the Archer and the Blitzu Gator 320 and note the differences:1. Archer is aluminum case and is well constructed and slightly heavier than Blitzu2. Blitzu is plastic case and lighter3. Archer light output is much brighter/stronger  and a warmer color temperature even though both have similar  lumen rating4. Blitzu is easier to slide on/off with simpler tab to disconnect lock tab5. Archer tab release to slide off/on is less ergonomic but still functions. The strap gets in the way of the flange slide - it still works just need to be cognizant that it may need to move out of the way. Nit picky....6. Archer guarantee 18 months vs 12 moths for Blitzu7. Archer water rating is IPX4 vs Blitzu IPX5 which might be better.8. Blitzu recharging port on bottom vs Archer at the rear end. Archer could be recharged without taking off strap, not so for Blitzu unless you rotate the unit so it faces upward. Blitzu port being on bottom might make less prone to water intrusion...perhaps9. Blitzu taillight is CR2032 battery is added expense whereas Archer is rechargeable10.  Archer recharge time is 7 hours - Blitzu is listed as 2.5 hours11. Archer lists light duration/run times twice of Blitzu12. Archer price $17.99; Blitzu now has price reduced to $11.0413. Both rotate horizontally with the Blitzu having a smooth rotation whereas the Archer has click stops.Clearly you get what you pay for and just on brightness output and less operating cost, the Archer for me is the better. That said, the Blitzu is a bargain and is lightweight if that is important. Both seem so far to have good build and function. No long term use so far so no comment about reliability, etc..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021

Review Text: This came from a recommendation from my friend Tom and I was extremely happy with it.  Very easy to charge, install and battery retains charged despite being unused for weeks.  I firmly believe in being seen when running with the cars (bulls) and have experienced NOT being seen only once (side swiped on my motorcycle) and it took a couple of years to recover.  I had blinking front and tail lights on my motorcycle and only hit once in over 40 years.  I've been told that my random blinking lights stand out even on a sunny day and wearing high viz clothing etc will hopefully make me the one to watch! ;-))I really like the straps as it can mount to my mtn bike or fat road bike handle cars.  It has multiple light settings so even when I need a quick flashlight I can grab my front light and use it easily due to the straps.  I don't ride at night but dusk is usually the most dangerous and I've been told again that my lights are bright enough.  Component quality is great and for the price .... in my opinion this should be a requirement for all bike riders!Thanks Tom P.!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Review Text: I ride just over 20 miles each day on pavement and groomed trails. There are no mountain bike trails but the groomed trails are bumpy in a few places. The mounting attachments for these lights are rubber, designed to make the lights adaptable to more bicycles. The rubber part is a strap with holes that can hook at several lengths depending on the needs of the owner. The large light is probably too heavy and unbalanced for the mounting attachment to be adequate. I lost the front light after about 45 miles but heard it hit the ground and was able to retrieve it. Two days later, the second time it came lose, I didn’t see or hear it go. Now it’s gone.These lights are bright enough for commuting in daylight.  I was able to ride 4 hours before a charge on the front light and about 6 hours on the rear light. The light switches are the type that work by cycling through the settings until you hit the one you want. I usually ride with the light set at slow flashing strobe. Brightness is OK but nothing exceptional. That’s fine because I don’t ride at night. Would I buy these lights again?  No, the mounting apparatus is inadequate for the large front light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

Review Text: It was easy to install and plenty bright for what I needed, but only the third time of charging the head light just stopped working. Plugged it in to charge and there was no red light to charge. I left it over night and then the next day tried it out and nothing. Opened it up and the battery is still attached and all, but there is nothing working. SO it was good for the few times I used it, but then there was nothing. I do not know if this is something that happens frequently, but it was annoying. The back red light still works, and I have not had any problems with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020

Review Text: Decent product, for sure. Bright enough. Haven't run out of a charge yet, but I do not do much night riding. Review Text: This light is very bright at night.  Flashing headlight features are great for daytime safety.  Mounting system is flexible, and light can pivot left/right by design.  No matter where you mount it, you can easily position the headlight to get optimal light at night.  Headlight is also good at illuminating at a distance and still showing a wide (but not too wide) area close in.  This headlight is lightweight and balanced, so it tends to stay in place even over bumps.  The taillight is also very bright, and the pattern options make you more visible on the road.  Tail light does NOT pivot left/right, so not as flexible as headlight.  Cannot comment on battery longevity other than to say that when fully charged, it put out max light (front and back) for at least an hour and was still at 100% brightness.  Will make another night time run without recharging and update comments later.  Definitely worth the price.  Well made.  Recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021

Review Text: Point zero: YMMV. You might find the front light to have no problems at all, but in my experience,1) the light was too heavy for the ring clamp, and its angle slid down as I rode, and2) the groove-and-tab holding the light onto the ring was objective trash.Day 1: the light fell off on what I'd call a low-stress road. Night 1: it fell off again, and I never want to put it back on.If you live in a low-theft environment, and can just duct tape the light to its mount, you're PROBABLY good?The rear light, so far, has been fine, but it's only night 1, and time stretches forward like a vast carpet of potential disappointment and frustration.

Review Text: Not as white and bright as blitzu but gets the job done. Has a wider light spread but more on the yellow side and NOT on the pure white side. I don’t think it would last long if it gets rained on. Considering it’s one of the cheaper ones out there not bad though. The rear red led looks good and slim profile doesn’t look corny and it’s bright enough. Seems good for the price but not the greatest
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020

Review Text: The white light is bright enough. I used it for some nighttime gravel riding in extremely dark conditions in a rural area and it did the job fine.The red light is also fairly bright, though I don't like any of the flashing patterns: I suspect they all would be too annoying for people behind me. The red light comes bundled for free, though, so I guess that's that.Back to the white light: The casing is plastic, which was a bit of a disappointment because I'm used to my good old Teorder aluminium light (which you can't buy anymore as it tends to happen with these transient brands). The plastic on this one feels reasonably sturdy considering the price; but again, my old light wasn't that much more expensive and it felt *leagues* more robust. We'll see how this one holds up after a few months of outdoors use.I'm definitely unhappy with the build, it could do with more careful QA: The light has - or rather, it *should have* - two small indents that latch on the holding bracket to secure the light in place (marked in red in the attached picture). One of these indents wasn't properly cut out, so the light wouldn't sit correctly on the bracket. I had to break off some of the plastic with a screwdriver until eventually the thing more or less sat in place as intended; which is surely not what you want to be doing with a newly bought product, no matter how cheap.The mounting bracket's rubber belt is shorter than I'd like - I have to stretch it uncomfortably around my bike's bars to the point I wonder how long it will hold up before it starts tearing - and the plastic feels way too flimsy for the amount of strength I have to apply to remove the light. I'm fully convinced that this bracket will break one way or the other in the near future. Hopefully it can be replaced with a generic one, but, again, this shouldn't be the kind of thing one is thinking about with a product that's less than a week old.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2021

Review Text: Have had the light set for 7 months. It is installed on a custom built e-bike so the bike is always stored indoors/climate controlled and clean. The rubber strap for the headlight broke mid ride on one side rendering it useless. The tail light strap appears to be suffering the same fate, leaving it be until it finally gives.-No cleaning solutions ever touched the lights/straps-I am at high elevation and have high UV but the bike never sits outsideEither old or poor quality rubber for the straps I received. Will try to jimmy rig a new strap but the way it attaches to the light itself is proprietary (Raised and notched to seat tight) so they will most likely get binned or donated.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020

Review Text: I seem to be going through front lights like crazy. The weak point is the mini-USB port. I've tossed two lights because they stopped accepting a charging cable after a while. This one seems a bit sturdier. It has four modes: Solid high, solid low, blinking high, and blinking low. Although I don't use it for night riding, when I go through some pedestrian/bike underpasses I can see the light on the walls. It is bright. The taillight is more of a tag-along item. This one has the best USB connector of any I've had and it has a similar choice of four types of light: solid, fast blink, slow blink, irregular blink. It's plenty bright as well. The one thing I don't like is the front mount. It uses a rubber band with holes in it for different diameter handlebars. The perfect setting would be between one that is too loose and one that is too tight. But even the tight one allows the mount to rotate when I remove the light for charging. It is a nuisance, not a deal breaker. So far, this is the best front/back combination light I've had. Did I mention that both lights are rechargeable? A full charge lasts at least 90 minutes, which is my longest ride with it so far. I expect it would go 4 hours easily.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

Review Text: The taillight works well: easy to see in daylight, with long battery life and easy recharging. I especially like the charging port rubber cover; it's solid and easy to reposition after charging. The headlight is a deal breaker for me, though. It's bright and has several flash options to make it easily visible in daylight. The problem is that when it's turned on, my bike computer is really erratic: speed jumps around wildly. I suspect electronic interference, since if I remove the headlight from the handlebar, the computer returns to normal behavior. My computer is a Specialized Wireless Sport, so it's no cheap knockoff. If you don't have a wireless computer, this would be a nice set.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020

Review Text: This review is only for those riding on streets.  I do not ride off road..First, the packaging is excellent.  Very sturdy box and packaging, with compartments for each included item.  The lights came with a charge, but I connected the supplied usb cables to give them a full charge.  The red charging lights turned green after 2 hours of charging.The front and rear lights installed easily and securely to the handlebars and the seat post.  The front light stayed secure during my rides on streets.  I did not test them off road.  The different light modes are very useful for day or night riding.The charge lasted pretty much as in the instructions.  They charged back up well.This is a great buy and highly recommended.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020

Review Text: Great value for normal use! The front headlamp is very bright, as described. And the different flashing functions are all you need. The rear brake lamp could be brighter, but it does the trick for normal use. My only gripe is the silicone straps that hold on the lights. They are very easy to install and very convenient for taking on and off, but they tend to slide down the frame or handlebar, unlike sturdier more permanent fixtures. My fix for that was to put some self-adhesive stretchy electrical insulation tape around the frame or handlebar to go underneath the silicone straps. That tape sticks very well and it is tacky enough to hold the silicone straps in place better. Just an idea.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020

   The headlight is quite bright and seems to mount securely to the bike handlebar.
