Review Text: Very bright light with a nice long range.  Long lasting battery life for those 35 mile bike rides.  Great product& nicely priced.  I would definitely recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020

Review Text: It’s always a little uncomfortable buying a half brand/no-name product. I took a chance on these because they were cheap and rechargeable. Once I got them, my mind was blown! The packaging was really well put together, they felt like a namebrand product in the hand. After a quick charge and installing them on my bike (which was quite easy I must add) I took them for a ride.For the price the brightness level totally blew me out of the water. Both front and rear lights stayed Sterley attached to my bike and didn’t move at all. There are four settings on both lights, which are pretty nice. I tend to use the full brightness on the headlight and the slow flash on the tail light. There’s also a slow flashing mode for the headlight which I use during the day so people driving can see me more easily.I’ve never been able to completely discharge the battery, when I get home after a really long ride I’ll just plug them in and they’re ready to go for the next time I go riding. Taking them off and reinstalling them is a breeze. It’s just a rubber belt style mount, which has its pros and cons. If you live in an apartment or a place where you don’t want to leave your lights attached to the bike taking them off is a breeze. Just pull on the bell tab and they pop right off. I’ve been on some pretty rough trails and they haven’t budged at all when they are installed on the bike. I would say they completely hit it out of the park!I liked this product so much that I bought my mother A pair for her bike as well. Not having to buy batteries is such a huge plus! I don’t ride super often at night, but if I did these are so cheap that I would consider buying a second set to have double the brightness level! Trust me on this, you cannot go wrong!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2021

Review Text: This light is fantastic. Brightness is very good, but has 2 levels, and even the lower setting was brighter than 4 other lights we bought, and later returned. Battery life on full power is about 2 hrs, and probably 6-7 hrs on low setting which we use most of the time. Item was shipped fast and received in great condition. The only drawback for me is the Micro USB connector, but I can live with it. I'm ordering a couple extras because I want to to have more for a few years to come. Products change too fast, and go off production... for the price.. seriously order 2!!The red tail light is nice because it too is USB charged, but it's nothing fancy.. just a decent red tail light that can be seen far enough away.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2020

Review Text: This is my first set of lights for my bike so I can be seen while I'm riding around. For the price, these lights are perfect. The headlights are nice and bright and they do throw the light quite a way. The same can be said for the taillight.However, I have two gripes about them. It says to charge the lights before the first use and the indicators will turn green in about 2-4 hours or less to let you know that it was full. But the headlight never turned green even after charging it for about 4 hours. It still works without issues but I was kinda skeptical of it. And the one-star demerit goes to the clip for the taillight. I never took the taillight off from the mount after charging it but somehow the light fell off the mount. I noticed it was missing during my ride when I reach back to adjust the light setting and it was gone. The strap was still there but the light was gone. It could be possible that the jolting knocked it loose but I'm not sure. I will buy another one just that I will change the orientation of the strap. But other then that, I say buy it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020

Review Text: Delivery was fast, and the light set comes nicely packaged. Lights were already charged, so I could use them right away. The lights attach easily. Headlight is very bright. I like the blinking options, especially since it can prolong battery life. So far, very good!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2018

Review Text: At this price point, you will not find a brighter, more-durable and long-lasting rechargeable light. I charged the front and back lights around Halloween and they are still going strong - use about 2-3 times a week for about an hour each time. I personally prefer the blinking front light and it has a very far throw, hitting stop signs about 2 blocks away.Were so good, I ordered an extra set for my wife's bike. Honestly, you can't go wrong with these lights. Oh, total 7 seconds of install time - just wrap the strap around the bars and the seat and hit the road.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019

Review Text: I was originally pleased with the purchase. Not 100% enamored.  The lights were plenty bright and charged relatively easily and quickly via USB. On a 2011 Carbon fiber frame both front and rear mounts were very snug, yet the front mount continued to slip when the headlamp on it and woul dnot stay focused level ahead.  I was disappointed in the battery life of the headlamp and tried riding with various settings - I see the description now includes some battery life estimates per mode - I have been unable to really get more than 4 hrs of lamp time regardless which mode I use.I was impressed/happy with the rear lamp, seeing 10+ hours of time before it shut off on it's own, which meant I charged the headlamp each ride and the tail lamp every other ride.  Despite the shortcomings I would have still rated it a 5 star for the value.11 months from my order date exactly, the rear lamp fell off; the mount's plastic tab broke off completely. Combined with the front mount no longer securely holding the lamp (it doesn't "lock in") which started a month or two ago I am now not only much less satisfied, but left without a way to mount the rear light entirely.  It seems any warranty is about 6 months, but I will try to contact Seller anyway.  If no solution (or resolution) I will likely shop for another make, modle, brand, etc possibly with a velcro strap mounting option.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021

Review Text: I couldn't find the light I wanted. The one I had used for years was not longer available. This seemed like the best alternative. When it arrived, it was larger than I hoped it would be, and I wasn't too sure about the mounting. However, my old light was not holding a charge, so I gave it a try. I was pleasantly surprised. It mounted easily and stayed put very well. It is very bright, and it holds a charge well. It doesn't seem heavy on my bike. As it turns out, I am very happy with this light and can recommend it. It does seem to take quite a while to charge, and the instructions didn't make it clear that the indicator light would turn green when it is fully charged. I figured that out after it charged over night. All in all, it is a great light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021

Review Text: These lights are easy to install using the new rubber mount systems found on many of the new bike accessories. Not sure about how these new mounts will endure however. The head light is very bright and is not only good for being seen but also to light a sizeable area in front of you. The tail light is also very visible. Both have multiple lighting modes. They seem to hold their charge very well. They have usb rechargeable power systems which I have not had to use yet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021

Review Text: Rear light battery is terrible and can’t be counted on .  Amazon page says rear light lasts a “long time” , and that turned out to be a lie. I focused on the 2000ah number but that is be for the front light only . There is no charge indicator to tell you what the charge level is, and the light has a nasty feature of simply turning off rather than dimming or fading away . So you have no way to tell if you can enjoy a ride in safety or if you’ll risk running lightless. Need to charge it every other day and I only use it an hour a day at most . Too late to return , going to throw out this piece of junk and buy one with regular old batteries that last at least a month and dim to let you know when it’s time to replace..: before you ride
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

Review Text: Great visibility with this light. It's not the bright bluish light it is easy on your eyes. But that's not the end of the story.I bought two sets of these lights for me and my wife. Out of the box they worked wonderfully, easy to install, great visibility... all the things that you want out of such a light.My problem is is when it came to recharging. Using the same USB outlet to recharge both lights, one light charged perfectly and the other literally did not charge it all. It's light lit up green when charging but once unplugged it was totally dead. Even after hours of charging.We got one use out of that light. It would not recharge.I went to contact the seller to see about a possible return and i was 2 days late for a possible return.The light (cost wise) was initially a good deal or so I thought. But at a 50% success rate it just sucks. The failed one is just junk after 1 run on it's charging.I was hoping to contact the seller but could not figure out how. I will not buy again.

Review Text: This light pair is pretty great for the price, the tail and head light can be seen from far and has different modes for day or night use, the battery life on both the headlight and taillight are great for extended rides or in case you forgot to charge between rides. The brightness on the headlight is acceptable for riding speeds around 25mph or lower but lacks that extra power at higher speeds. I appreciate the light comes with a glare reducer so I’m not blinding oncoming cars. Customer service is great, I had the rubber strap for the headlight tear on me so I reached out and was quickly sent a replacement. These are good lights and a good company to buy from! My only wish was that they’d release a light kit with a brighter lumen mode headlight option.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020

Review Text: Overall the light functions are really well, the fact that it's rechargeable is extremely convenient. The housing mechanism for the charging ports are a little, overly waterproof, the rubberized blocking systems are kind of tough to get back in.The light itself has multiple brightness settings with the brightest being very bright and very visible and even the dim being still visible whereas not to being too harsh. There are also flashing modes.The mounting systems are pretty cheap and pretty flimsy, after removing it to charge the hook mechanism keeping the light attached broke. Very weak very thin plastic. The part that actually mounts it to the bike is fine enough although I don't think it'll hold up in a fer years.Mine was still usable after some super glue and a little bit of ingenuity.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021

Review Text: The mount for this is the absolute worst I've ever seen. The loose grip allows the front light to rotate around the handlebars changing the light direction. <<< This was the best part of the mount. The clip was not strong enough to keep the light attached to the mount. I say was because the front light fell off while I was crossing a busy 4 lane and couldn't retrieve it before it was smashed. So I payed for this light and got 2 month's use from it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: Purchased this light for my mobility scooter. I needed a light that would allow me to transverse on our property after dark. The light was a little difficult for me to secure the mount on my own, but my grip strength is impaired and I think it needs to be as snug as it is to stay secured. With the light, I am able to see decently in front of me - enough so that I comfortably drive on a hard dirt surface. During our farm's pumpkin season, I was even able to scan our outdoor display area after dark well enough to tidy up, look for damaged or misplaced fruit, and even assist the last customers of the day searching for the perfect carving pumpkin at the last minute. In addition, the charge has held well for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021

Review Text: Looking for a nice, all in one light set for your bike? Want something easy to use, well built, and reliable? Want all of this for a descent price? This set checks all the boxes.Well packaged, nice looking, and easy to use.Headlight is bright - just slightly less bright than some 1100 lumen flashlights I have, but very nice for lighting the way for a street or bike path ride.Tail light is brighter than I expected, also very nicely visible.Construction is clean and feels very solid.Mounting straps are pretty common rubber stretch-hook style with an added touch of ratcheting pivots that allow for nicely positioning both lights.Overall very happy with this purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020

Review Text: I bought this light in the summer as it began to get darker earlier. Now, I refuse to ride without it. I have a flat bar hybrid and I place it on the opposite side of my phone mount. The base twist so that I can still shine the light directly ahead. I have the rear light mounted to my seat post. The headlight is amazing. It is so bright, I have actually been flashed at by cars and other cyclist. The battery in the headlight is obviously not as long lasting as that in the rear light, but I have been able to complete consecutive 1-1.5 hour rides without the light dying and using it on high. When the light is dying, the power button flashes red which is a nice indicator that it is time to head back to the car or change the light output to flash. I rarely every use the low beam function because I actually feel like I can't see as well. I will only switch to it if someone indicates that ny light is too bright.Each light has four modes and you have to cycle through them completely to turn the light back off. The button is a super easy press so its not a huge inconvenience. The headlight is nearly as bright as my 2019 LED lights on my car and the distance they cover is amazing, so you will have no problem being seen. I love these lights!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021

Review Text: I use this light-set on my mountain bike. The two brightness settings come in handy on a bike/pedestrian, 2-way trail. The brightness is as bright as other handheld rechargeable flashlights I've bought and used. The battery life has worked well for me, though I've never truly tested its capabilities. I use it at least 3 times a week, for 45 min to 1 hour rides, then I recharge the set (once a week). As far as the mount that comes with it, I was skeptical of the rubber band/straps, but I have not had any issues with the light maintaining aim or falling off, while riding on bumpy trails. I'm probably getting another one to use as a headlamp, because these are very affordable and work very well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Review Text: I really liked my lights for the short amount of time I had them, with the sun setting earlier and earlier as we got closer to fall and my work schedule always going late, I felt safe taking out our bikes as the sun would set before we got back home.Sadly one day I left with my headlight attached to my handlebars, but returned with just the mount attached with no idea where the light went. Also I have no idea if I had just attached the light back on poorly so I don't really know why it left me, so I won't blame it on the mount itself.So I do plan on repurchasing this set when we get close to the end of summer again, since the days are just starting to get longer again and I shouldn't need a headlight for a while.Although the taillight is still working despite sitting in the freezing cold garage all winter!

Review Text: I love the easy to mount and remove system...but that's about it! I ordered 2 sets, one for my bike and one for my son's bike. One of the two sets is defective but the other seems to work as advertised. In the defective set, the headlamp dies very quickly on a full charge (less than 1 hour) and the tail light does not hold a charge at all. I turn it on and it dies within minutes. When charging it never indicates it is fully charged after hours when it's only supposed to charge for 90 minutes. It's too bad but it is made in China - cheap quality. It gets dark in Tacoma WA at 4:30 pm in winter and I don't expect the working set to hold up with nightly use. Take a gamble or shop elsewhere.

Review Text: Although I found this product initially adequate, I rate it a 2 out of 5 stars.The headlight is okay, but it is a narrow beam of light and I wish I would have selected something with more lumens.  The headlight on this unit has 400 lumens and is adequate if there is secondary light around (e.g. street lights, stores, etc.).  Where I ride is VERY dark.  Hence, I believe after having used this headlight, I need at least double or triple the lumens (maybe 800-1,200).  Buyer beware on claimed lumenocity though.  Some good 400 lumen units are as bright (or brighter) than some claiming 800, 1,200, 2,500, plus.As for the taillight, it stopped taking a charge after 2.5 months.  I plugged it in after nearly every ride, and very recently it just didn't charge anymore.  For only $14 (what I paid in late 2020), this set gets a mere "meh" from me.I will be replacing this set with something brighter and that has better charging durability.  Would be nice if the company/manufacturer of this set were to reach out to me and offer a replacement.  Better yet, make the batteries removable so that when the cheap, Chinese batteries fail, we can put our own rechargeable batteries in this instead of throwing it away.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021

Review Text: Mounted this on my road bike for my first ride and the headlight fell off. I didn't realize it had fallen off, so I wasn't sure where to go back and look when I finally noticed it was gone. Never found it. I got it for those early morning rides, but this time it was bright enough outside I didn't even end up using it. Seemed like it had solid brightness, but the mount is just too weak (a very simple plastic clip). I actually liked how easy it was to install/remove the mount from the handlebars, thinking I could use this for early morning mountain bike rides as well, but there's no way it would have survived the bumpiness of a mountain trail because the clip isn't solid enough to hold it in place. The rear one works well, so there's that.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020

Review Text: I bought this for my daughter since biking to school in winter has been very dark and scary in the mornings.We live in an area with no paved sidewalks and fairly rural feel so many bumps, branches, etc.  Anytime the bike jostles too hard, the front headlight slides out of its base.  It frustrates her to the point where she'd rather throw it in her backpack rather than reattach it back. Which means she's biking in the dark dangerously.  I may need to try to maybe superglue it on.Other than that, the lights are great, love the options they give for brightness and blinking.  Chargelife is long too.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019

Review Text: I really liked this light, good brightness, easy to attach, multiple settings. I had it for less than two weeks and I was riding home from work and the front light popped off the holder and shattered; leaving me to ride the rest of the way in the dark. My assumption is that the vibrations from riding loosened it... not even two weeks and I have to find a new light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020

Review Text: Loved this light...for two days. Worked fine. Bright. Thought it would be just what I needed. Unfortunately, went to my bike today and tried to turn the light on. NOTHING. Thought it might be uncharged (although only used it for an hour or so). Took charge fine, but NOTHING. Went to Amazon to return and ended up with a rep who tried to diagnose/fix it. Was told to hold ON button for a few seconds while charging, and presto! The light came on. Guess what? The danged light then would not cut off. No mode changes. Nothing. Just a bright light that would not turn off. Finally, the rep decided to have me return it for an exchange. I hope the new one is better, but I have my doubts.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021

Review Text: The good: The lights are fine. Not quite as bright as I was hoping for, but adequate. Battery life was also great. Never ran out during a ride unless I didn't charge it beforehand. Also used in rain and had no issues.The bad: The headlight actually slips downward when going over rough surfaces, which leads to having to constantly adjust it. Pretty frustrating to have to deal with, but solved by putting a little bit of grip tape on my handlebar where I mount it at. The worst part though is all it took was the bike tipping over once for the rubber to break on the headlight. I didn't wreck. The bike was propped up and my kid accidentally knocked it over.I came here in hopes of buying a replacement part for it since it comes in 2 parts and the light itself is fine. I was prepared to give this 4 stars and pay for a replacement band. It gets a 2 because it's fragile and doesn't offer replacement parts.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020

Review Text: I got this bike light for daily commutes, and use it at most 30 minutes a day. It was bright enough to help me see the road at night, and held a charge for about a month of daily use. However, once I recharged it, it now runs out of battery within 5 minutes on the road, even after charging it overnight. It seems to work ok when I test it out inside, so maybe the battery is now sensitive to colder weather (50 F or below). The rear light works great, but I'd recommend skipping this and looking for a light with better longevity.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020

Review Text: I remember when lights twice and big and heavy put out less light and consumed tons of batteries.  I can't believe the performance of such a small and lightweight set.  Easy to install (although I am not sure how the "rubber band" style mounts will hold up) and looks like it won't mar the finish on my new road bike.  If you want to be seen this is the light set for you.  It will produce enough light for commuting and with the rechargeable batteries will provide and additional value over time.  Not really enough light for serious off road night riding but at the cost of the set you could add a few more or spend way more money on a high output light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021

Review Text: ***Summary***This is a good light for the price. Mounts easily, charges fast and easily via USB, is very bright, don't need anything more. You can find brighter ones but they're significantly more expensive.**********************Details*****Was caught unawares when riding the other day and the darkness set in real fast on this trail I was on. I had no light and was barely able to see. I was just dinging my bell in the hopes that people could hear it and I would be fine. Decided to prioritize getting the lights as soon as I got home, and they were delivered the next morning at 7 am, fast!Installation was super easy, you just loop the strap around your handlebar like you're putting on a watch or a belt, and then hook it into the hook. It stays secure even on the bumps. Same for the rear light. I mounted my power bank onto my handlebar using velcro tape and used that to recharge my light (and phone) while biking in daytime. It arrived with decent charge and didn't need that much extra charging, but I was just trying to be careful.The light has 2 brightness settings: full brightness (300 lumens), and half brightness (150 lumens). It also includes two strobe settings: slow and fast. The half brightness was good for when it was just early darkness, just prior dusk, and then full brightness was needed after dusk in the wooded unlit areas.I posted a picture of the light at full brightness, half brightness, and off. I used my Sony a7III that I carried with me for photography and took all photos at the same settings, so there's no cheating the exposures. What you see in that photo is the actual difference between the brightness levels (and off). It's decently bright. I could see the reflectors on the unlit biker coming the other direction in pitch darkness. The light doesn't carry too far though, so it's more for immediate vicinity and for other people toWorth it for the price, and would definitely recommend. Will edit this post after I've had more time with the light if there are any issues that come up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021

Review Text: *Updated after 7 months of use:  The headlight cuts out after 45 minutes-hour of use.  I've had this happening over the last month where I've been on a road ride with it on steady flashing and it will just shut off.  When I notice that it's off and try to turn it back on, it flashes once and then remains off.  I keep it charged weekly, after 5-6 hours of use, but it seems to only work as it did when it was new on the first ride after a charge.  No issues on the rear strobe, just the front.Got these for my road bike to replace some old battery operated lights.  These are bright, have 2 flashing modes each to catch drivers eyes, and the headlamp will also strap to my helmet for night rides in the woods for a spotlight.  Charges quickly and get multiple rides a week per charge.  Well worth the price.

Review Text: I ride 300+ days a year so a dependable light set is important. I had long ago tired of the hassle of having to change batteries every time I forgot to switch off a light. I knew that there were USB charged lights out there but the ones that I had run across were a bit cost prohibitive for my budget. Then one day after finding my tail light was dead AGAIN I decided to go online and see what I could see. Sure enough, up pops this set by Ascher. When I first saw the lights and read the specs I thought I'd be paying at least $50 for them. Then I saw $15, my jaw dropped and my finger went "Click". The lights are amply bright and hold a charge fo a good while. Not sure if they are still at the same price point but knowing what I know now I would still pay a bit more for this set.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019

Review Text: Bought this light for the rides in the dark when I need to light up the road to see better. This light is bright enough and wider angle allows you to see very well in the dark. I have 2 headlights on my bikes when riding after sun goes down or cloudy days, one that flashes to let other people/cars notice me and this one to have to see the road/path clear enough to avoid potholes debris and other obstacles. This light is easily bright enough for that. Cannot comment on battery life as I only used twice. Rubber straps mount to lots of handlebars and can be moved from bike to bike with ease. I like this light and it's price tag. Hopefully batteries will last and won't have to charge them all the time. I mostly use lights with aaa batteries but will give this a try.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019

Review Text: As other commenters have written, the light is VERY bright however charging it takes forever (hours for indicator to go green) and the strap which holds the light to the handle bar is elastic which allows it to move around requiring constant repositioning.  My solution is to use a Scotch Removable Mounting Square which keeps it from moving BUT still will allow me to pull off the strap if I need to.  This light and the rear light are MUCH brighter than a battery powered light I originally bought.  Your choice is to replace AAA batteries constantly, or wait 4-5 hours to recharge the light.  The light is removable from the strap so its not a problem when you need to recharge it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Review Text: The mounting is quick and easy and I like that both lights can be quickly installed and removed with a quick release clip. The headlight is very bright on the high setting and even bright on the low setting. The tail light is extremely visible. Each light has a flashing setting the attract attention even during the day if you desire. I am very pleased with the heavy duty nature of both lights. Charging was quick and easy. I also was pleased that it came with a USB charging cord for each light so that both can be charged at the same time. The headlight also makes an excellent flashlight to have in the car. I may order another just for that purpose. Excellent value.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021

Review Text: Nice, bright light for my 4 am commute to work. Only needed to be recharged 3x in 4 month. After 15 minutes of trying to get a full on, it stopped doing that.Real waste of money and no way to contact seller.

Review Text: We bought two sets to use daily while commuting in early mornings in harsh environments. Have used in 120 degrees and nearly freezing. We leave them installed unless charging, although installing and removing are fast and easy. . For the price, excellent deal. The headlight is very bright And has a high, low and two flash modes. The tail light also has high low and two flash modes. The usb charging is very convenient. Using an hour a week, we charge every couple weeks. I don’t have any negatives for our application. If riding aggressively, downhill or off-road, I would expect the weight of the headlight to cause shift but it’s heavy duty, I’d figure out a way to secure it and still use it.

Review Text: I misplaced my son's bike lights last year and I can't find the same ones being sold anymore, so I bought this set to try out.  We use bike lights when camping because our kids are often riding campground loops during and after sunset.  By the time I charged them up to use for camping this summer, the Amazon return window was closed and I found that the back red light would not work after charging.  I contacted the company directly, they tried troubleshooting first.  When that did not work, they replaced the light.  I can't speak for long term durability yet, but the front light is much much brighter than my old one, and also bigger / bulkier.  I was initially turned off by the bulkier size because I use the lights on small kids bikes, but I don't have any real reason to take issue with it, I guess.  Customer service was fantastic when I found that my one light not working.  Communication was quick and easy.  In the future I would not hesitate buying from Ascher again knowing that if I have any issues, they will be willing to help solve the problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020

Review Text: I commute to my work every day. The ride is only .6 miles but during the fall and winter it is very dark early in the morning and early in the evening so I get to use it every day. I even had a couple of rides under the rain and it is still working.  The headlight is very bright and has four modes: brightest, low level, normal blinking, and double blinking with a pause. The rear light is good too and has four modes: very bright, low level, normal blinking and fast blinking.The headlight lasted a month when the recharge red light turned on, but it did not turned off. I used a fast charger so it was ready the next morning. The rear light kept working but I recharged it the next day, just in case. I definitely recommend this product if your commute is short like mine. I do not know how long it works for long rides.No complaints from me. And since this is so cheap, you could buy one every other month and be SAFE on the streets.
